ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Greatly bolstered my ability to better answer questions and create stories within a new language.
A continuation of Hindi skills since L1.
Foundational Hindi knowledge -builds a lot on grammar concepts from L1 and gives even more practice
improved reading, writing, listening, and speaking in Hindi (future+subjunctive tenses, conditionals, ect)
This is a followup to the first semester. I learned to better read the script. Since we also knew basic sentence structure, we were able to learn many new verb tenses.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A very flexible attitude with a clear purpose of teaching hindi for the sake of learning. Greatly motivates all students.
Great course with wonderful Professor and TA. Fewer assignments than L1 and class seemed a little more unstructured since L1.

Strengths: Swapna ji is amazing - so chill, so fun, and makes the class a delight to go to every morning, my hindi has improved so much over 2 semesters
Weaknesses: not much, maybe integrating review of old vocab so we dont forget + focusing vocab on the most applicable words, sections could be smaller (like 3-4 ppl each) so that theres more speaking practice

strengths: casual course overall (daily HW but nothing too intensive, weekly quizzes but never too difficult) but still learned a lot

no weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, swapna ji is a good teacher
Yes, for those interested in learning hindi it is a great course to learn in a smaller class with a lot of direct interaction within class to practice what you learn.
Highly! TAKE HINDI AT YALE, its great!
Yes, if you're interested in learning Hindi, this is the way to go - you'll learn a lot and work is very chill/they're flexible
